commit_message:
Remove nova_* options from guestagent

These options are unncessary according to Tesora, and they are a
security risk. The nova user has admin privelges. If your use spins up a
trove instance then snapshots it, they'd be able to get admin
credentials in your cloud.

Change-Id: Ie1f46fde9369033315e299e01d5c7f848bdd2696

commit_message:
Remove legacy v2 API tests which use wsgi_app()

There is fakes.wsgi_app() for testing legacy v2 API code, but the
method becomes unnecessary. So this patch removes the method and
unit tests which used the method for legacy v2 API.

NOTE: This patch just removes the test of createserverext extension
      which is not documented and not tested with Tempest.
      The extension is not implemented and seems unnecessary legacy.
      Let's remove the test.

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: I0eaa0a9860af7d574a689722785d5d3d614eb0c1

commit_message:
[WIP] Improve gate testing for security role

This patch removes the skipped tags in tox.ini and carefully skips
some problematic tasks using conditionals. This enables more of the tasks
to run in the gate but skips some failures that would normally cause
the gate job to break.

Change-Id: Idfabf33073715e74eca757078a1c2a9c745d6cf9

commit_message:
Revert "modify firewall_driver"

Short names are supported, and have been for a long time via PBR magic.

See Ia04fb7dd352707cd372a6c710df0f230dce3c5a0 for the original patches
that introduced using the short names.


This reverts commit 9a34c13dac17b24c794a6e2e87882aabe8c6fddd.

Change-Id: Ic7451f1d140f760ac41cda04e421baa2f9e55924

DOCS: Clean up of the Mitaka upgrade guide

Forming to conventions applied in the install guide.
This cleans up RST, spelling, and grammar fixes.

commit_message:
Ensure all role dependencies are consistently specified

We should always specify the 'scm' and 'version' attribute
for every role we depend upon.

Failure to do so can cause errors in certain 2.x versions
of Ansible.

Change-Id: Icfc22769f2415a9e86eb843e1228291f0849218b

commit_message:
Include patches recursively in RPM package

Parametrize the RPM spec with python2 macros and add
patches to  the build directory recursively  to make
sure that all of them are included.

Change-Id: I49488776047b32b0a939bbbe435c0c286eabedee
Closes-bug: 1585528

added_lines: Heat requires an OpenStack release of Grizzly or newer, but bear in mind that Grizzly is EOL. The current stable release_ is, of course, recommended.Instructions for installing the RDO OpenStack distribution on Fedora are available at ``https://www.rdoproject.org/Quickstart`` Instructions for installing Heat on RDO are also available at ``https://www.rdoproject.org/Docs`` Alternatively, if you require a development environment not a package-based install, the suggested method is DevStack, see instructions at :doc:`on_devstack`Check out the example templates at ``https://github.com/openstack/heat-templates``. commit_message:
Implement removal_policies for AutoScalingGroup

This closes a small gap between ResourceGroup and AutoScalingGroup: both
are now able to remove specific resources.

Change-Id: I757edf0fde980f839f7e46234a4f9663c4a53d13

Bind pseudo parameters to template versions

This patch binds the pseudo parameters to
template versions so that we can manage
adding pseudo-parameters over time.

commit_message:
Add option to enable introspection of UEFI nodes

By default, ironic-inspector does not support introspection of machines
with UEFI-only firmware. This allows deployers to turn this on.

Change-Id: Ie742ea49ec77f5b334a8e4479803af5dd6d25047

Move parameters from stack to raw_template

parameters/environment is temlpate specific and bettter
to be held under raw_template. Also this will help in
moving towards backup stack removal.

commit_message:
Allow to provide an expected exception to `wip` decorator

Sometimes it is needed to expose a bug with a test and show that a
specific exception occurs.

Add a parameter to `wip` decorator which allows to pass an exception
that will be caught. Any other exception will cause the test to fail.

Change-Id: I8fc87fd96e03fe87bc1187e9c9c04914236604d3

commit_message:
Use keyston Session for nova client

Pass keystone session and auth_plugin instead of tokens.
Such client handles reauth by ownself.

commit_message:
Use existing trust context if possible

In some cases it is possible that heat will be called with
trust scoped token that has been created via heat trust_auth_plugin.
For example, create mistral template with workflow that create heat
stack. After resource-signal to this workflow heat load stored trust
context and send a signal to mistral using trust scoped token generated
by trust_auth_plugin. After that mistral calls heat stack-create with
the same token and fail trying to create new trust. The reason of
this fail is that we try to create new trust using already created
trust token with allow_redelegation=False option. But there is no reason
to create new trust that is identical to existing one. Return already
created trust context in such cases.

Closes-Bug: #1513821
Change-Id: Ic6ca549187fd3ec29cdf137121e8357769f3e423

subject: Change the default Fuel's Keystone token expiration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 12:28:58.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/fuel/manifests/params.pp', 'deployment/puppet/fuel/examples/keystone.pp', 'deployment/puppet/fuel/manifests/keystone.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/1e124941fb0621dcde868d39238573dffdda8d6a', 'message': "Change the default Fuel's Keystone token expiration

The amount of time a token remains valid should be decreased to
reduce potential security risks. This commit changes the defaults
to 6 hours. Also, this commit contains some styling cleanups.

Change-Id: I8563f89a1165d1f423ef59a86fab0f95a8444a25
Closes-Bug: #1585130
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0f2304fdff1bc12c096e0db3497b0fc8833488b2)
"}]
commit_message:
Change the default Fuel's Keystone token expiration

The amount of time a token remains valid should be decreased to
reduce potential security risks. This commit changes the defaults
to 6 hours. Also, this commit contains some styling cleanups.

Change-Id: I8563f89a1165d1f423ef59a86fab0f95a8444a25
Closes-Bug: #1585130
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0f2304fdff1bc12c096e0db3497b0fc8833488b2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/55/320955/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $token_expiration = $::fuel::params::keystone_token_expiration, token_expiration => $token_expiration,

commit_message:
Add gate-senlin-dsvm-tempest-api job to senlin's experimental queue

This patch add a gate-senlin-dsvm-tempest-api job for senlin API tests.
Use 'check experimental' to trigger this job.

Change-Id: I7f0c5f8ebc7c315d69c97f0446a719324efdfccf

commit_message:
Updating os_zaqar to use the Multi-Distro framework

* The default apt packages have been moved into a var file that is only loaded when the detected OS is matched.
* The Install task file has had the apt specific tasks moved into a named install task file.

Change-Id: Id95826a9dd9e5d2ed83a95c3f02d18929735a8f2
Implements: blueprint multi-platform-host

commit_message:
Remove remaining BGP code from neutron

There still are BGP codes in neutron repo, this patch remove it.
It was missed in commit I20b6ddd37d10eae70e8294d578e53137c0f866fe

Change-Id: I6bf71b14a03ccc005dcd4d67078e7e9f4a7ed197
Closes-Bug: #1584333

commit_message:
Add network_mode selector for Docker resource

Support setting a network mode (host | none | container:id)
for containers. This allows more advanced networking to be configured
and for some users may also simplify connectivity to Neutron.

Change-Id: Ib375c3039f3de78abbe822980fb6140178b74314

commit_message:
Add devices property to Docker resource

Allows mapping host devices into a container, useful
for performing GPGPU work, mapping /dev/urandom:/dev/random, etc.

Change-Id: I17dfd96c1595922b77668f81eb5a054d8e70d3ad

commit_message:
Add restart_policy to Docker resource

Allows passing the Docker restart policy to a container,
values being the same as accepted by the Docker API.

Change-Id: I655c7572a6b38e79a1d104057183a760ac4dd317

commit_message:
Add capabilities management to Docker resource

Allows resource definitions to add or remove Linux capabilities from
the default set used by Docker. This allows a more granular approach
to adding privileges to a container than the Privileged property,
but also allows hardening containers beyond the default Docker settings.

Change-Id: I4c87dd42171dda318c7f1947e5c6a24913dc344a

commit_message:
Upgrade RabbitMQ Server to 3.6.2

Change the default install version of RabbitMQ Server to 3.6.2.
Tests have been updated to upgrade from 3.6.1 to 3.6.2 and an unused
test vars folder has been removed.

socat has been added as a new dependency to work around a known issue
with systemd: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/issues/664

Change-Id: I2a4d127a852e7780dd95f905f3e1d5d1df60028a

subject: Tighten the access rules for galera
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 19:56:19.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp', 'puppet/controller-post.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/a046b1be6cf73607a0dc0c3d1eed43629bb6f771', 'message': "Tighten the access rules for galera

Set a password for the 'root' db user and add an additional
'clustercheck' user to be used only by the resource agent.
The password for this 'clustercheck' user is randomly generated
via a heat parameter.

Before this change the workflow to set up the database in the
manifest is the following:
- Step 1 -> Install all the basic galera packages and basic configuration
- Step 2.a -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with root and empty password
- Step 2.b -> Start up galera-monitor xinetd service
- Step 2.c -> Start pacemaker ocf resource (no root user has been created
  so there will be an empty password per default)
- Step 2.d -> Wait for /bin/clustercheck to return success and then
  proceed with the other steps

After this change the workflow is slightly more complex because there
is a bit of a chicken and egg problem:
- Step 1 -> Install all the basic galera packages and basic configuration
- Step 2.a -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with root and empty
  password unless the file does exists already and has a clustercheck user
  configured
- Step 2.b -> Start up galera-monitor xinetd service
- Step 2.c -> Start pacemaker ocf resource (no root user has been created
  yet, so there will be an empty password per default)
- Step 2.d -> Wait for /bin/clustercheck to return success and then proceed
  with the other steps
- Step 2.e -> Create clustercheck db user
- Step 3 -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with clustercheck user credentials
- Step 5.a -> Update the sql root password on the each node (at this
  stage
- Step 5.b -> Create /root/.my.cnf with proper credentials on all nodes

Note that we cannot really create the root/clustercheck users right at
step 1 because the db is not running yet (an approach that spawned
mysqld on each node, created the users and shut it down, was tried but
was much more complex and cannot work on updating existing setups)

Given the new way of solving the root password issue, we also need to
make sure that Step1 and Step2 are running on updates.

Notes:
There was one rebasing conflict because in mitaka step 3 and 4 are
completely separated.

Closes-bug: #1581677

Depends-On: I83eed8885503043e881db34411616f9726e00352
(cherry picked from commit e734d752d4f37e93a1637560f9f515320bbe68c5)

Change-Id: If3d6e7253af6195b96129be7ea3348d697e4bae1
"}]
commit_message:
Tighten the access rules for galera

Set a password for the 'root' db user and add an additional
'clustercheck' user to be used only by the resource agent.
The password for this 'clustercheck' user is randomly generated
via a heat parameter.

Before this change the workflow to set up the database in the
manifest is the following:
- Step 1 -> Install all the basic galera packages and basic configuration
- Step 2.a -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with root and empty password
- Step 2.b -> Start up galera-monitor xinetd service
- Step 2.c -> Start pacemaker ocf resource (no root user has been created
  so there will be an empty password per default)
- Step 2.d -> Wait for /bin/clustercheck to return success and then
  proceed with the other steps

After this change the workflow is slightly more complex because there
is a bit of a chicken and egg problem:
- Step 1 -> Install all the basic galera packages and basic configuration
- Step 2.a -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with root and empty
  password unless the file does exists already and has a clustercheck user
  configured
- Step 2.b -> Start up galera-monitor xinetd service
- Step 2.c -> Start pacemaker ocf resource (no root user has been created
  yet, so there will be an empty password per default)
- Step 2.d -> Wait for /bin/clustercheck to return success and then proceed
  with the other steps
- Step 2.e -> Create clustercheck db user
- Step 3 -> Create /etc/sysconfig/clustercheck with clustercheck user credentials
- Step 5.a -> Update the sql root password on the each node (at this
  stage
- Step 5.b -> Create /root/.my.cnf with proper credentials on all nodes

Note that we cannot really create the root/clustercheck users right at
step 1 because the db is not running yet (an approach that spawned
mysqld on each node, created the users and shut it down, was tried but
was much more complex and cannot work on updating existing setups)

Given the new way of solving the root password issue, we also need to
make sure that Step1 and Step2 are running on updates.

Notes:
There was one rebasing conflict because in mitaka step 3 and 4 are
completely separated.

Closes-bug: #1581677

Depends-On: I83eed8885503043e881db34411616f9726e00352
(cherry picked from commit e734d752d4f37e93a1637560f9f515320bbe68c5)

Change-Id: If3d6e7253af6195b96129be7ea3348d697e4bae1

commit_message:
Implement 16.04 support in Keystone

This change creates a ubuntu 16.04 variable file that will allow
the role to be executed against a ubuntu 16.04 host.

Change-Id: Ib6d7e68133de8d10b81d9116b74dca1de7568897
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Deployment graph tasks parameters now saved in Transaction before deployment

Deployment tasks snapshot is now saving during DeploymentTask message creation
in Transaction.tasks_snapshot field.

Methods:

    * attach_tasks_snapshot
    * get_tasks_snapshot

are added to Transaction model.

Handler /transactions/:transaction_id/deployment_history/
now showing tasks parameters in output and supporting
request parameter:
/transactions/:transaction_id/deployment_history/?tasks_names=task1,task2

Change-Id: I59446ef456f7d3bd249c686b7a8e1a93a364daf2
Partial-Bug: #1563317
DocImpact

commit_message:
Implement neutron pods and service

(note: this need fix from:
- https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1584954
- https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-kubernetes/+bug/1584921)

This change implement a bootstrap job,
defines pods and service for neturon.

Pods and their containers:
neutron-compute
  | --------- openvswitch-db-server
  | --------- openvswitch-vswitchd
  | --------- neutron-openvswitch-agent
  | --------- neutron-linuxbridge-agent

neutron-control
  | --------- neutron-server

neutron-network
  | --------- neutron-dhcp-agent
  | --------- neutron-l3-agent
  | --------- neutron-metadata-agent

Change-Id: Idfcda98ba5092b7a1ed6995786876c8325501ea4
Partially-implements: blueprint openstack-services

commit_message:
Add automated testcases for unlock-settings tab and remove-vendor-code

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/unlock-settings-tab

add cases:
Check that "load deployed" button is not shown for cluster in "new" state
Check that any settings are unavailable till deployment process is in progress
Check "deploying changes" warning behavior
Check "Load deployed settings" button behavior
Check "deploy changes" button avaialability

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/remove-vendor-code

add cases:
Check that name removed from header logo and bottom "copyright" on generic pages
Check that name removed from header logo and bottom "copyright" on cluster tabs

Change-Id: I875f012e8c1086f256a61e2ee8e3f7ec26d09f7c

See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. **/ import registerSuite from 'intern!object'; import Common from 'tests/functional/pages/common'; import ClusterPage from 'tests/functional/pages/cluster'; import DashboardLib from 'tests/functional/nightly/library/dashboard'; import DashboardPage from 'tests/functional/pages/dashboard'; import Modal from 'tests/functional/pages/modal'; import NetworksLib from 'tests/functional/nightly/library/networks'; import 'intern/dojo/node!leadfoot/Command'; import 'intern/dojo/node!leadfoot/Session'; import 'intern/chai!assert'; registerSuite(() => { var common, clusterPage, dashboardPage, dashboardLib, modal, networksLib, clusterName; var loadDeployedBtn = 'button.btn-load-deployed'; var cancelChgsBtn = 'button.btn-revert-changes'; var saveNetworksChgsBtn = 'button.btn.apply-btn'; var saveSettingsChgsBtn = 'button.btn-apply-changes'; var deployBtn = '.deploy-btn'; var clusterStatus = '.cluster-info-value.status'; return { name: 'Unlock "Settings" and "Networks" tabs', setup() { common = new Common(this.remote); clusterPage = new ClusterPage(this.remote); dashboardPage = new DashboardPage(this.remote); dashboardLib = new DashboardLib(this.remote); modal = new Modal(this.remote); networksLib = new NetworksLib(this.remote); commit_message:
Simplify RG handle_update logic

Simplifies RG handle_update by removing unnecessary
scheduler jobs when not updating in batches.

Change-Id: I612ce88f1047f6363c44a01907e44917df3ab490

Use scaling library for RG assemble_nested

Changes assemble_nested to use library to create member
definitions.

commit_message:
WIP:Change time calculations to use oslo_utils timeutils

This patch replaces time calculations to use
oslo_utils.timeutils wherever possible.

This also replaces time.sleep with eventlet.sleep.

Change-Id: I0c274d3566ed800314371ac3e0974d5634447a38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/62/205962/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.stack.created_time = timeutils.parse_strtime( '1970-01-01', '%Y-%m-%d') self.stack.updated_time = timeutils.parse_strtime( '1970-01-01', '%Y-%m-%d')
deleted_lines: import datetime as dtdatetime = dt.datetime self.stack.created_time = datetime(1970, 1, 1) self.stack.updated_time = datetime(1970, 1, 1)

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Nova-API. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Nova.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Nova, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ia78f73e96585ab33a379a0b0be6d9682f7fbd810
Closes-Bug: #1573766

commit_message:
Forced flush of tmp file to disk on ui retrieval

UI retrieval routine loads the package's temporary file  from disk
to properly render its ui. This procedure does not close the file
before reading it, so the write buffers should be flushed first.

This was causing the bug when the UI could not be properly fetched
from the API.

Change-Id: I53cd08945c826dd18a7308f9f007d50241bb9041
Closes-bug: #1565805
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/40/320540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add support for static routes

This patch add support for static routes, since OVN supports
static routes, this patch is used to add/remove the static
routes to/from OVN northbound DB.

The OVN static routes implementation is here:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/28dc3fe9763fb18122590fec559a2215a66dc078

Closes-Bug: #1539347
Change-Id: I2fe71559a5410e5f0f0e60aedb907cd75f2597d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/98/315398/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.common import utils as n_utils added = [] removed = [] router_name = utils.ovn_name(id) """ Update static routes """ if 'routes' in router['router']: routes = router['router']['routes'] added, removed = n_utils.\ diff_list_of_dict(original_router['routes'], routes) if update: if added or removed: try: with self._ovn.transaction(check_error=True) as txn: for route in added: txn.add(self._ovn.add_static_route(router_name, ip_prefix=route['destination'], nexthop=route['nexthop'])) for route in removed: txn.add(self._ovn.delete_static_route(router_name, ip_prefix=route['destination'], nexthop=route['nexthop'])) except Exception: LOG.exception(_LE('Unable to update lrouter for %s'), id) super(OVNPlugin, self).update_router(context, id, original_router) raise n_exc.ServiceUnavailable()

commit_message:
Add scenario test for AWS loadbalancer

Also was added Fedora-Cloud-Base-20141203-21.x86_64
image for supporting AWS LoadBalancer.

Closes-bug: #1443953
Depends-On: Ief9470fd74ad1f3bcb696a3eb58d840a8db099c3
Change-Id: Ib703d9e62fbd13c1d39fa50494f0f10073be19f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/92/153192/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat_integrationtests.common import test class LoadBalancerTest(test.HeatIntegrationTest): template = ''' { "AWSTemplateFormatVersion": "2010-09-09", "Description": "LB Template", "Parameters" : {"flavor" : {"Type" : "String"}, "image" : {"Type" : "String"}, "AZ" : {"Type" : "String", "Default" : "nova"}}, "Resources": { "WikiServerOne": { "Type": "AWS::EC2::Instance", "Properties": { "ImageId": {"Ref": "image"}, "InstanceType" : {"Ref": "flavor"}, "UserData" : "some data" } }, "WikiServerTwo": { "Type": "AWS::EC2::Instance", "Properties": { "ImageId": {"Ref": "image"}, "InstanceType" : {"Ref": "flavor"}, "UserData" : "some data" } }, "LoadBalancer" : { "Type" : "AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancer", "Properties" : { "AvailabilityZones" : [{"Ref": "AZ"}], "Instances" : [{"Ref": "WikiServerOne"}], "Listeners" : [ { "LoadBalancerPort" : "80", "InstancePort" : "80", "Protocol" : "HTTP" }] } } } } ''' def setUp(self): super(LoadBalancerTest, self).setUp() self.client = self.orchestration_client if not self.conf.image_ref: raise self.skipException("No image configured to test") if not self.conf.minimal_image_ref: raise self.skipException("No minimal image configured to test") if not self.conf.instance_type: raise self.skipException("No flavor configured to test") def test_basic_create_update_loadbalancer(self): env = {'parameters': {'image': self.conf.minimal_image_ref, 'flavor': self.conf.instance_type}} stack_identifier = self.stack_create(template=self.template, environment=env) self.assert_resource_is_a_stack(stack_identifier, 'LoadBalancer') self._wait_for_stack_status(stack_identifier, 'CREATE_COMPLETE') update_template = self.template.replace( '[{"Ref": "WikiServerOne"}]', '[{"Ref": "WikiServerOne"}, {"Ref": "WikiServerTwo"}]') self.update_stack(stack_identifier, update_template, environment=env) self._wait_for_stack_status(stack_identifier, 'UPDATE_COMPLETE')

commit_message:
Replace deprecated oslo_db sqalchemy EngineFacade to enginefacade

Now at oslo_db EngineFacade is deprecated. Instead of
oslo.db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade.LegacyEngineFacade use
oslo.db.sqlalchemy.EngineFacade.
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L830

Change-Id: I72c7f3eeacd5e8624ec3ad270813954c9b48148a

commit_message:
Merge "Add Release notes for fixes backported to 0.2.1"

(cherry picked from commit 0bb80b43b01ad0dbf63923087f5d1b8ae54455d7)

Change-Id: I269c2fd32a511ffb21252200163dd4ec0ae6d9aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/53/320753/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: | The initial mitaka release (0.2) did not support ElasticSearch 2.x. ElasticSearch made several changes to internal index data mappings that were not backwards compatible with ElasticSearch 1.x. This release has all the changes required for Searchlight to support both ElasticSearch 1.x and 2.x. Searchlight now supports oslo pools instead of requiring a different topic for each listener. This simplifies deployment configuration. Previously, services would have to be specifically configured to send notifications to the Searchlight topic. With this change, Searchlight can share topics with other services such as Ceilometer. upgrade: - To support ElasticSearch 1.x and 2.x, several internal data mappings have been updated. If you previously deployed Searchlight, you will need to reindex your resource data using ``searchlight-manage index sync``. You may re-index everything or limit it to ``OS::Nova::Server``, ``OS::Glance::Image``, ``OS::Glance::Metadef``, ``OS::Cinder:Volume``, and ``OS::Cinder::Snapshot``. - | To start using a pool with a shared topic instead of separate topics: * Update the respective service configuration files for searchlight enabled plugins to only publish to a single topic (e.g. set ``notification_topics = notifications``). If you have Ceilometer enabled, this must be the same topic which Ceilometer uses. You also typically must restart each service for the change to take effect. For example, in ``nova.conf``, ``glance-api.conf``, ``cinder.conf``, ``neutron.conf``, and ``designate.conf``: :: notification_topics = notifications * Update ``searchlight.conf``. In the ``[resource_plugin]`` section, set ``notifications_topic`` to match the shared topic that you set in the service configurations. In the ``[listener]`` sections, set ``notifications_pool`` to your desired pool name. The default name starting in Newton is ``searchlight``. The ``notifications_pool`` does not have to match anything from other services configuration files. For example: :: [resource_plugin] notifications_topic = notifications [listener] notifications_pool = searchlight fixes: - Bug 1570213 Apply query to highlight query - Bug 1532010 Ensure consistency in mapping field types - Bug 1570674 Fix unicode error when booting instance from volume - Bug 1570199 Fix inconsistent mapping in image plugin - Bug 1568709 Remove port.create.end handler from nova - Bug 1565015 Add volume.retype event - Bug 1583215 Correct Cinder exchange value - Bug 1583215 Enable notification messaging pools

subject: Replace revoke tree with linear search
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-02 02:25:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/82853bc41581ebaf4e9da16c3c13592af321e96d', 'message': 'WIP replace revoke tree with linear search

Change-Id: Ib6a686494e897840b09d134ecf1ca50ce712f281
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-03 21:09:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/b2ef3f1b643fa70aaeec5add60107f58c468daaf', 'message': 'Replace revoke tree with linear search

Change-Id: Ib6a686494e897840b09d134ecf1ca50ce712f281
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-04 18:48:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/5125e6b84f01bb52804c02476413564a4354d423', 'message': 'Replace revoke tree with linear search

The RevokeTree was built out of an attempt to optimize the search for
a match between a candidate token and the list of revocation events.
The performance proved to be poor, mostly due to the cost of creating
and checking hash values.

The RevokeTree code is also so complex that most of the team could not
understand it or troubleshoot it.  There are some subtle bugs due to
race conditions with revocation events, and it is impossible to track
them down due to the code complexity.

This change replaces the tree based search with a linear search through
the list of revocation events.  A failure-to-match will pass through
the entire list.  A revoked token should match on O(n/2) comparisons.

With the past year of Fernet tokens in deployment, the feedback is that
the number of revocation events is small, and they only are kept for
the lifetime of the tokens (usually 1-8 hours) so the linear search is
not expected to slow down token validations in live deployments.

Future work will also reduce the number of revocation events.


Change-Id: Ib6a686494e897840b09d134ecf1ca50ce712f281
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-05 01:46:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/c337875d79d5656409701c6a12cd46110fe015a6', 'message': 'Replace revoke tree with linear search

This change replaces the tree based search with a linear search through

The RevokeTree code is also so complex that most of the team could not
understand it or troubleshoot it.  There are some subtle bugs due to
race conditions with revocation events, and it is impossible to track
them down due to the code complexity.

This change replaces the tree based search with a linear search through
the list of revocation events.  A failure-to-match will pass through
the entire list.  A revoked token should match on O(n/2) comparisons.

With the past year of Fernet tokens in deployment, the feedback is that
the number of revocation events is small, and they only are kept for
the lifetime of the tokens (usually 1-8 hours) so the linear search is
not expected to slow down token validations in live deployments.

Future work will also reduce the number of revocation events.

Change-Id: Ib6a686494e897840b09d134ecf1ca50ce712f281

commit_message:
Replace revoke tree with linear search

The RevokeTree was built out of an attempt to optimize the search for
a match between a candidate token and the list of revocation events.
The performance proved to be poor, mostly due to the cost of creating
and checking hash values.

The RevokeTree code is also so complex that most of the team could not
understand it or troubleshoot it.  There are some subtle bugs due to
race conditions with revocation events, and it is impossible to track
them down due to the code complexity.

This change replaces the tree based search with a linear search through
the list of revocation events.  A failure-to-match will pass through
the entire list.  A revoked token should match on O(n/2) comparisons.

With the past year of Fernet tokens in deployment, the feedback is that
the number of revocation events is small, and they only are kept for
the lifetime of the tokens (usually 1-8 hours) so the linear search is
not expected to slow down token validations in live deployments.

Future work will also reduce the number of revocation events.

Change-Id: Ib6a686494e897840b09d134ecf1ca50ce712f281
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/52/311652/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Migrate identity /v3 docs from api-ref repo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-23 21:09:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/71cd2a635625f08af686c66fc6efbe8b05bd4e20', 'message': "Migrate identity /v3 docs from api-ref repo

Docs at [1] have already been converted from WADL (SGML / XML) to RST
using fairy-slipper [2].

This commit polish the results from the conversion and migrate the docs
to our repository under 'api-ref/source' directory.

Polishing the generated RST files include:
- Removing unnecessary blank lines;
- Removing empty references.

Polishing the generated RST files do not include:
- Modifying their content;
- Modifying file names;
- Wrapping lines at the maximum of 79 chars.

Updating the documentation will be done after this migration step.

This change also adds a tox environment to build the docs using sphinx
under 'api-ref/build', which in turn is added to '.gitignore'.

Lastly, 'os-api-ref' is added as a test requirement. It provides the
sphinx stanzas rest_method and rest_parameter, used to define OpenStack
APIs in RST docs.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/api-site/tree/master/api-ref/source/identity/v3
[2] https://github.com/russell/fairy-slipper

Change-Id: If1b9a3e1b2e4ea7211c337071254c26b881893a3

commit_message:
Migrate identity /v3 docs from api-ref repo

Docs at [1] have already been converted from WADL (SGML / XML) to RST
using fairy-slipper [2].

This commit polish the results from the conversion and migrate the docs
to our repository under 'api-ref/source' directory. In addition, it
added missing descriptions for access_token_id and consumer_id to
'parameters.yaml'.

Polishing the generated RST files include:
- Removing unnecessary blank lines;
- Removing empty references.

Polishing the generated RST files do not include:
- Modifying their content;
- Modifying file names;
- Wrapping lines at the maximum of 79 chars.

Updating the documentation will be done after this migration step.

This change also adds a tox environment to build the docs using sphinx
under 'api-ref/build', which in turn is added to '.gitignore'.

Lastly, 'os-api-ref' is added as a test requirement. It provides the
sphinx stanzas rest_method and rest_parameter, used to define OpenStack
APIs in RST docs.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/api-site/tree/master/api-ref/source/identity/v3
[2] https://github.com/russell/fairy-slipper

Change-Id: If1b9a3e1b2e4ea7211c337071254c26b881893a3

commit_message:
Process url to calculate node selection

When page is loaded, initial node selection should base on the url.

Closes-Bug: #1584808

subject: crypto - don't break conditional GETs on unencrypted objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 19:37:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/4bae78ee7d4c2d7d13287fbe570559dd96efca2a', 'message': 'crypto - don't break conditional GETs on unencrypted objects

We handle conditional GETs in the encrypter by (a) encrypting the
If-(None-)Match etag values and adding them to the list of etags
to match and (b) setting X-Backend-Etag-Is-At to point to the
X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag value.

Unfortunately if the target object pre-existed encryption being
enabled, or was PUT while crypto was temporarily not in a proxy
pipeline, then there will be no X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag in
the object sysmeta.

That's ok for a replication policy since the object server logic
falls back to use the Etag metadata which is the correct value to
match against. But for an EC policy the correct value to match
against in this situation is X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Etag, which is
not found because the encrypter set X-Backend-Etag-Is-At to point
to X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag.

This patch fixes that by making X-Backend-Etag-Is-At be a list of
possible alternate etag locations, to which the encrypter and then
the proxy EC PUT path can append there respective alternate locations.
Then the object server inspects each in turn until a value is found
to match against.

So in this case we would have X-Backend-Etag-Is-At equal to
"X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag,X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag" and for
the unencrypted EC object the object server would find the alternate
etag value at X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag.

The patch also adds a set of tests to verify this behaviour by
reusing the test server framework from test/proxy/test_server.py

Change-Id: I46ba5b1074a62e57d261e010e1c9df0393ee9609

commit_message:
crypto - don't break conditional GETs on unencrypted objects

We handle conditional GETs in the encrypter by (a) encrypting the
If-(None-)Match etag values and adding them to the list of etags
to match and (b) setting X-Backend-Etag-Is-At to point to the
X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag value.

Unfortunately if the target object pre-existed encryption being
enabled, or was PUT while crypto was temporarily not in a proxy
pipeline, then there will be no X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag in
the object sysmeta.

That's ok for a replication policy since the object server logic
falls back to use the Etag metadata which is the correct value to
match against. But for an EC policy the correct value to match
against in this situation is X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Etag, which is
not found because the encrypter set X-Backend-Etag-Is-At to point
to X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag.

This patch fixes that by making X-Backend-Etag-Is-At be a list of
possible alternate etag locations, to which the encrypter and then
the proxy EC PUT path can append there respective alternate locations.
Then the object server inspects each in turn until a value is found
to match against.

So in this case we would have X-Backend-Etag-Is-At equal to
"X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag,X-Object-Sysmeta-Ec-Etag" and for
the unencrypted EC object the object server would find the alternate
etag value at X-Object-Sysmeta-Ec-Etag.

Change-Id: I46ba5b1074a62e57d261e010e1c9df0393ee9609
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/40/314740/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_object_transient_sysmeta, update_etag_is_at_header, \ resolve_etag_is_at_header update_etag_is_at_header(req, "X-Object-Sysmeta-Ec-Etag") resp._conditional_etag = resolve_etag_is_at_header(req, resp.headers)

commit_message:
Update OSA to use Ansible "stable-2.1"

This change adds Ansible 2.1 support to the OSA project by updating
the openstack-ansible CLI tool to use "stable-2.1" as the default
installation branch. This change temporarily changes the default
installation method to use git instead of pypi. The default
installation source has been changed because Ansible 2.1 is not
currently on PyPi because its still in RC testing.

The human readable log output for the gate has been commented out
because the module does not support Ansible2.1 at this time.

Change-Id: I33ac20ebbc00fca4df00aaa3753ef75e575a23cf
Implements: blueprint ansible-2-1-support
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/24/317224/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif [[ "${ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_PYPI}" = true ]]; then else echo "No installation option has been provided." exit 99ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_PYPI="${ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_PYPI:-false}"ANSIBLE_GIT_VERSION="${ANSIBLE_GIT_VERSION:-stable-2.1}" -bup|--bootstrap-use-pypi) ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_PYPI=true ;; ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_PYPI="${ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_PYPI}" -bug|--bootstrap-use-pypi | Use pypi to boostrap your Ansible runtime The set option is ${ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_GIT} if [[ "${ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_GIT}" = true ]] && [[ "${ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_PYPI}" = true ]]; then echo "Both git and pypi options to bootstrap the Ansible runtime have been enabled. Please choose one." exit 99 elif [[ "${ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_GIT}" = false ]] && [[ "${ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_PYPI}" = false ]]; then export ANSIBLE_INSTALL_USE_GIT=true fi

subject: Isolate Ansible from the deployment host
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 20:06:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/fcf8d3df8073fc75df9b3e31297f60a27a071734', 'message': 'Isolate Ansible from the deployment host

This change allows the Ansible to be installed and executed from within
a virtual environment. The openstack-ansible command wrapper has been
rewritten to allow for auto-bootstraping based on a known version of Ansible
which  can be changed using command line or environment variables.
The ``openstack-ansible`` command is able to execute playbook, galaxy, and
adhoc commands all within the isolated runtime. While the option to execute
the other Ansible commands exists the API for typical ``openstack-ansible``
usage has not changed.

The main purpose of this tool is to allow the deployer to leverage various
versions of Ansible with relative ease. As the core project upgrades versions
of Ansible the wrapper tool will be key in allowing that upgrade to take place
without major system disruption.

Notable Features:
  * Install Ansible from git or PyPi within a virtual environment
  * Ansible execution environment is contained within a versioned virtualenv
    which allows for fast switching between Ansible versions while also ensuing
    the host is not polluted with Ansible dependencies.
  * If the option `--osa-config` is used the CLI tool will temporary bind
    mount the extra configuration path over the known "/etc/openstack_deploy"
    directory. This is done to allow a deployer the ability to build multiple
    clouds from a single host using multiple directory trees without having to
    manually move files around or create symlinks.

Change-Id: I41e60ffdcb0b0013ea41f150c05e7ace96b566dc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 20:14:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/b6959abc5172aea6c7bff6b11b0ef13664b604a2', 'message': 'Isolate Ansible from the deployment host

The main purpose of this tool is to allow the deployer to leverage various
versions of Ansible with relative ease. As the core project upgrades versions
of Ansible the wrapper tool will be key in allowing that upgrade to take place
without major system disruption.

Notable Features:
  * Install Ansible from git or PyPi within a virtual environment
  * Ansible execution environment is contained within a versioned virtualenv
    which allows for fast switching between Ansible versions while also ensuing
    the host is not polluted with Ansible dependencies.
  * If the option `--osa-config` is used the CLI tool will temporary bind
    mount the extra configuration path over the known "/etc/openstack_deploy"
    directory. This is done to allow a deployer the ability to build multiple
    clouds from a single host using multiple directory trees without having to
    manually move files around or create symlinks.

Change-Id: I41e60ffdcb0b0013ea41f150c05e7ace96b566dc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2016-04-13 05:54:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/03407f03f715f81a81777ff0456f6280bf73434b', 'message': 'Isolate Ansible from the deployment host

This change allows the Ansible to be installed and executed from within
a virtual environment. The openstack-ansible command wrapper has been
rewritten to allow for auto-bootstraping based on a known version of Ansible
which  can be changed using command line or environment variables.
The ``openstack-ansible`` command is able to execute playbook, galaxy, and
adhoc commands all within the isolated runtime. While the option to execute
the other Ansible commands exists the API for typical ``openstack-ansible``
usage has not changed.

The main purpose of this tool is to allow the deployer to leverage various
versions of Ansible with relative ease. As the core project upgrades versions
of Ansible the wrapper tool will be key in allowing that upgrade to take place
without major system disruption.

    directory. This is done to allow a deployer the ability to build multiple
    clouds from a single host using multiple directory trees without having to
    manually move files around or create symlinks.

The main purpose of this tool is to allow the deployer to leverage various
versions of Ansible with relative ease. As the core project upgrades versions
of Ansible the wrapper tool will be key in allowing that upgrade to take place
without major system disruption.

Notable Features:
  * Install Ansible from git or PyPi within a virtual environment
  * Ansible execution environment is contained within a versioned virtualenv
    which allows for fast switching between Ansible versions while also ensuring
    the host is not polluted with Ansible dependencies.
  * If the option `--osa-config` is used the CLI tool will temporarily bind
    mount the extra configuration path over the known "/etc/openstack_deploy"
    directory. This is done to allow a deployer the ability to build multiple
    clouds from a single host using multiple directory trees without having to
    manually move files around or create symlinks.

commit_message:
Isolate Ansible from the deployment host

This change allows Ansible to be installed and executed from within
a virtual environment. The openstack-ansible command wrapper has been
rewritten to allow for auto-bootstraping based on a known version of Ansible
which  can be changed using command line or environment variables.
The ``openstack-ansible`` command is able to execute playbook, galaxy, and
adhoc commands all within the isolated runtime. While the option to execute
the other Ansible commands exists the API for typical ``openstack-ansible``
usage has not changed.

The main purpose of this tool is to allow the deployer to leverage various
versions of Ansible with relative ease. As the core project upgrades versions
of Ansible the wrapper tool will be key in allowing that upgrade to take place
without major system disruption.

Notable Features:
  * Install Ansible from git or PyPi within a virtual environment
  * Ansible execution environment is contained within a versioned virtualenv
    which allows for fast switching between Ansible versions while also ensuring
    the host is not polluted with Ansible dependencies.
  * If the option `--osa-config` is used the CLI tool will temporarily bind
    mount the extra configuration path over the known "/etc/openstack_deploy"
    directory. This is done to allow a deployer the ability to build multiple
    clouds from a single host using multiple directory trees without having to
    manually move files around or create symlinks.

Closes-Bug: 1431324
Implements: blueprint ansible-2-1-support
Change-Id: I41e60ffdcb0b0013ea41f150c05e7ace96b566dc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Provides 'equals' intrinsic function

Provides condition function 'equals' for hot template,
'Fn::Equals' for HeatTemplate, which versions
are 2016-10-14.

Change-Id: Ib0ffa76e6c562dfbddca5f9dce807f2c6ea3eb82
Blueprint: support-conditions-function
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/65/283365/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ---------- Fn::Equals ---------- Compares whether two values are equal. And returns true if the two values are equal or false if they aren't. Parameters ~~~~~~~~~~ value1: A value of any type that you want to compare. value2: A value of any type that you want to compare. Usage ~~~~~ .. code-block:: yaml {'Fn::Equals': ['Ref': 'env_type', 'prod']} Returns true if the param 'env_type' equals to 'prod', otherwise returns false.

commit_message:
Add initial ML2 mechanism driver support

This patch set adds the initial ML2 mechanism driver
suport while maintaining the core plugin support.
Deployments will continue to use the core plugin
by default. However, the core plugin will be removed
as part of a follow-on patch set which will complete
the conversion to ML2. In the meantime, dual maintenance
will be required once this patch merges.

This patch set supports the following:
- ML2 create, update, delete network
- ML2 create, update, delete subnet
- ML2 create, update, bind, delete port
- ML2 segments
- OVN worker and logical port events
- Security group callbacks and OVN ACLs
- L3 create, update, delete router
- L3 add and remove router interface
- Basic unit tests for ML2 and ACLs

A follow-on patch set will complete the remaining
conversion work which includes the following:
- DevStack and Vagrant deployment updates for ML2
- Documentation and release note updates for ML2
- OVN DB sync support
- QoS support
- Additional unit tests

Co-Authored-By: Richard Theis <rtheis@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Kasperski <jckasper@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I6143be464d4897b9fb22837797347746d82c41b0

commit_message:
Disable the rdisc service (if present)

This patch checks for the rdisc service on a host and disables the service,
if the service is installed. The service will be stopped immediately if it
is found to be running.

Documentation and release notes are included.

Closes-bug: 1584191

Change-Id: Ieeb2d25ecf1920448701c33d4ea623d3f65becf6

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary mock

In one of the unit tests, we unnecessarily mock os.path.join. This
seems to cause the test to hang on Python 3.4, as gettextutils will
hang when attempting to translate one of the messages logged by
the tested method.

For now, we'll just remove this mock as it's blocking the gate.
Still,We may have to understand better why we did not have this
issue before.

Change-Id: I7bec8755d98196eca6e7952cd493a997c71f2ca3

commit_message:
Refactor process test

The tests relied on psutils Python module which is not part of monasca.
The used functions and classes are substituted by mock objects that
simulate their behavior, making the test independent of third party
modules.

Changed the assertTrue calls to more specific asserts.

common.py is refactored to make it pep8 compatible

Change-Id: I6badfd3612ba52f55b73219b4581e94ff79cc73b

commit_message:
Publish os-api-ref to d.o.o

This publishes the docs for os-api-ref to d.o.o. We now have 6
projects already using this extension (at least one who started using
features incorrectly in it), and another half dozen in review to add
it. Having the usage and format docs discoverable would be great.

The governance review adding it to the doc program is here:
Ia6c53ab5a3f01cdbcffc6fd1d9e9ecc9b7bcc2e9

Change-Id: Ie2926d86107e2481d49343f40f0911098ca19871

Replace backticks with "$()" syntax

Backticks eat backslash from awk
expression.

Closes-bug: #1580963

commit_message:
Configure Nova Legacy endpoint

Patch I874726808f975cdea30459ef525cff0d00a5468c switched using v2 and v3
endpoints to only v2.1, because of upstream patch I8990ce21745fa7a995b92ed337622fa6ffc2756b.

Nova (v2) endpoint was not removed from Nova at all, but was renamed to
nova_legacy. And we still want to have nova legacy endpoint (v2) in Fuel.

Change-Id: I031872f5a9e9f0e2d076eb709f4e9ca2a41a5b60
Closes-bug: #1581459
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/38/319938/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it 'should contain legacy nova endpoint' do should contain_keystone__resource__service_identity('"nova_legacy"').with( 'configure_user' => false, 'configure_user_role' => false, 'service_type' => 'compute_legacy', 'service_description' => 'Openstack Compute Legacy Service', 'service_name' => 'compute_legacy', 'public_url' => "#{public_base_url}/v2/%(tenant_id)s", 'internal_url' => "#{internal_base_url}/v2/%(tenant_id)s", 'admin_url' => "#{admin_base_url}/v2/%(tenant_id)s", 'tenant' => tenant, ) end

commit_message:
[install] remove Debian specific procedure from tool

This is a following patch of I8df6b3b382137d08d60f85bc41bcd98ac1f4eb47
"Factor out Install Guide for Debian with debconf".
Mainly, remove Debian specific procedure from build tool.
Also, remove debconf content from Debian Install Guide,
but there are still some debconf content, which is needed to
cleanup at further following patches.

Change-Id: Iffced3907ac2fddd42e6adc56b6e4859fde8e987

commit_message:
Enable keystone v3 support for cinder_type

Previously, the cinder_type provider used Credentialsv2_0 when
creating a new type, so it did not support Keystone v3 environments.
Switching th Credentialsv3 to support both Keystone v3.

Change-Id: Iff8e21c922c2d90108053f70cbc053436e3461de
(cherry picked from commit c58a3d7cacec24448701ccfa4d7496b8056be81c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/56/320956/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if @credentials.version == '3' @credentials.user_domain_name = cinder_credentials['user_domain_name'] @credentials.project_domain_name = cinder_credentials['project_domain_name'] end if conf['project_domain_name'] creds['project_domain_name'] = conf['project_domain_name'] else creds['project_domain_name'] = 'Default' end if conf['user_domain_name'] creds['user_domain_name'] = conf['user_domain_name'] else creds['user_domain_name'] = 'Default' end

commit_message:
Robust wget config for building bootstrap

More robust wget config can improve debootstrap performance.

Change-Id: I5303a635a21d9fcd60dc2e02c36b635deafff631
Closes-Bug: #1566382
(cherry picked from commit 3733a7b86d04d871f43bc19591ee73032662d416)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/43/319943/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*config_wgetrc*] # (optional) Boolean. Writes more robust wgetrc config for the system # Defaults to 'false' ## config_wgetrc => true, $config_wgetrc = false, if $config_wgetrc { augeas { 'Add robust wgetrc settings': lens => 'Simplevars.lns', incl => '/etc/wgetrc', changes => [ 'set timeout 60', 'set waitretry 2', 'set tries 5', 'set dot_style mega', 'set retry_connrefused on', ] } }

commit_message:
Removed the db create tasks

The db create tasks have been removed from the role and have been
relocated into the playbooks.

Change-Id: I8b9761689f3c6c51a3a7b50e71c8acf040a6c32f
Depends-On: If58e482034a65c0e50241448dbe298a73c1ae71b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix L3 unit tests for ML2

Neutron profiling support added by [1] broke the L3 unit
tests for ML2. This patch set fixes the failure by ensuring
the profiler configuration is setup for the test.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273951/

Change-Id: Ib3e35da7d9515831eb6b2fa3576a960ce396b5b0
Partial-Bug: #1578198

subject: Remove auto_schedule_routers codepath
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 18:08:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9d152570872d3ad5a3c096ecdb1d880fc55a4578', 'message': "WIP: Remove auto_schedule_routers code and option

This patch removes the option and its code, which is equivalent to
changing the option's default to False. When set to True, the feature
schedules unscheduled routers whenever a L3 agent is started or
restarted. However, routers are already automatically scheduled
when they are created, even with the option set to False:

* Legacy routers are scheduled when an interface is added to them.
* HA routers, including DVR-HA routers  are scheduled when they are
  created.
* Distributed routers are scheduled to compute nodes automatically
  as needed, and the SNAT portion is scheduled automatically
  when an external interface is added to a router.

The only change here then, is that if a legacy router is created
(But no interfaces added), or if any other type of router is created
and then manually unscheduled by an admin via neutron l3-agent-router-remove,
restarting or starting a L3 agent would not automatically schedule said
router, which seems like a positive change. If the admin unscheduled
a router, I think he or her would expect it not to be rescheduled without
him or her explicitly doing it via the same way the router was
unscheduled. Note that the L3 agent does *not* periodically resync
routers.

The code and option should be removed because not only does
the feature not answer meaningful use cases, it introduces
a non-trivial amount of complexity and bugs.

Closes-Bug: #1499647
Closes-Bug: #1533460
Change-Id: I1977355cbf282cd3719b5b69732bcc072557e095
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-26 21:23:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/eae22684b42513770d544d39761ef22cf90ddaaf', 'message': "WIP: Remove auto_schedule_routers code and option

This patch removes the option and its code, which is equivalent to
changing the option's default to False. When set to True, the feature
schedules unscheduled routers whenever a L3 agent is started or
restarted. However, routers are already automatically scheduled
when they are created, even with the option set to False:

* Legacy routers are scheduled when an interface is added to them.
* HA routers, including DVR-HA routers  are scheduled when they are
  created.
* Distributed routers are scheduled to compute nodes automatically
  as needed, and the SNAT portion is scheduled automatically
  when an external interface is added to a router.

The only change here then, is that if a legacy router is created
(But no interfaces added), or if any other type of router is created
and then manually unscheduled by an admin via neutron l3-agent-router-remove,
restarting or starting a L3 agent would not automatically schedule said
router, which seems like a positive change. If the admin unscheduled
a router, I think he or her would expect it not to be rescheduled without
him or her explicitly doing it via the same way the router was
unscheduled. Note that the L3 agent does *not* periodically resync
routers.

The code and option should be removed because not only does
the feature not answer meaningful use cases, it introduces
a non-trivial amount of complexity and bugs.

It's reasonable to remove the option and its functionality without
a deprecation cycle because its not useful, doesn't do what it's
supposed to do, and is actively harmful.

Closes-Bug: #1499647
Closes-Bug: #1533460
Change-Id: I1977355cbf282cd3719b5b69732bcc072557e095

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-09 16:59:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2d969420a4af62dce7cc292a281d0c20bc517bd4', 'message': "WIP: Remove auto_schedule_routers codepath

Currently, auto_schedule_routers has a (rather large) codepath specific
to it. This large codepath exists *in addition* to the original
schedule() codepath in the L3 agent. This patch, therefor, removes all
this excess code in favor of using the original schedule() codepath.

TODO: Fix Jenkins, make sure it's reentrant.

Closes-Bug: #1499647
Closes-Bug: #1533460

'}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2016-03-23 09:25:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ff6f990c42d1da57eabf0663083cad258fd67ca9', 'message': "Remove auto_schedule_routers codepath

Currently, auto_schedule_routers has a (rather large) codepath specific
to it. This large codepath exists *in addition* to the original
schedule() codepath in the L3 agent. This patch, therefor, removes all
this excess code in favor of using the original schedule() codepath.

It's also important to note that this patch introduces a regression in
the form of auto_schedule not working for routers that are
under-scheduled. This means that if an HA router is scheduled to less
than 'max_l3_agents_per_router' and additional agents are available, the
router won't be scheduled to them automatically. This is a known
regression that we're putting in place to make the code safer and future
patches will put this functionality back into place.

Co-Authored-By: John Schwarz <jschwarz@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1499647
Closes-Bug: #1533460
Change-Id: I1977355cbf282cd3719b5b69732bcc072557e095

"}, {'number': 19, 'created': '2016-03-30 09:02:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/82588e91e9a8aa3edc6de2cbcf79d2d6d6adc745', 'message': "Remove auto_schedule_routers codepath

Currently, auto_schedule_routers has a (rather large) codepath specific
to it. This large codepath exists *in addition* to the original
schedule() codepath in the L3 agent. This patch, therefore, removes all
this excess code in favor of using the original schedule() codepath.

It's also important to note that this patch introduces regressions in
the form of auto_schedule not working for routers that are
under-scheduled. This means that:
1. If an HA router is scheduled to less than 'max_l3_agents_per_router'
   and additional agents are available, the router won't be scheduled to
   them automatically.
2. If a router was manually unscheduled by the tenant responsible, it
   won't be automatically re-scheduled to some other agent (or even the
   same, if it's restarted). This also effects non-HA routers.
These are a known regression that we're putting in place to make the
code safer and future patches will put these functionality back into
place.

Co-Authored-By: John Schwarz <jschwarz@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1499647
Closes-Bug: #1533460
Change-Id: I1977355cbf282cd3719b5b69732bcc072557e095

under-scheduled. This means that:
1. If an HA router is scheduled to less than 'max_l3_agents_per_router'
   and additional agents are available, the router won't be scheduled to
   them automatically.
2. If a router was manually unscheduled by the tenant responsible, it
   won't be automatically re-scheduled to some other agent (or even the
   same, if it's restarted). This also effects non-HA routers.
These are a known regression that we're putting in place to make the
code safer and future patches will put these functionality back into
place.

Co-Authored-By: John Schwarz <jschwarz@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1499647
Closes-Bug: #1533460
Change-Id: I1977355cbf282cd3719b5b69732bcc072557e095

Currently, auto_schedule_routers has a (rather large) codepath specific
to it. This large codepath exists *in addition* to the original
schedule() codepath in the L3 agent. This patch, therefore, removes all
this excess code in favor of using the original schedule() codepath.

It's also important to note that this patch introduces regressions in
the form of auto_schedule not working for routers that are
under-scheduled but not fully unscheduled. This means that if an HA

than one agent, and additional agents are available, the router won't be
scheduled to them automatically. This does not effect completely

code safer and followup patches will put these functionality back into

commit_message:
Remove auto_schedule_routers codepath

Currently, auto_schedule_routers has a (rather large) codepath specific
to it. This large codepath exists *in addition* to the original
schedule() codepath in the L3 agent. This patch, therefore, removes all
this excess code in favor of using the original schedule() codepath.

It's also important to note that this patch introduces regressions in
the form of auto_schedule not working for routers that are
under-scheduled but not fully unscheduled. This means that if an HA
router is scheduled to less than 'max_l3_agents_per_router' but to more
than one agent, and additional agents are available, the router won't be
scheduled to them automatically. This does not effect completely
unscheduled routers (so if a legacy/HA/DVR router has been completely
unscheduled from all its' agents, auto_schedule_routers still works).

These are a known regression that we're putting in place to make the
code safer and followup patches will put these functionality back into
place.

Co-Authored-By: John Schwarz <jschwarz@redhat.com>
DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1499647
Closes-Bug: #1533460
Change-Id: I1977355cbf282cd3719b5b69732bcc072557e095

Fix aodh tempest job

Currently, the Aodh tempest jobs actually run the functional tests, that
is because some wrong variables settings.

Create general function get_all with filtering + Call for Workbooks, Workflows, Executions, Actions, Action Executions, Tasks, Cron Triggers, Environments

Change-Id: I5742bdde2a81d467a2e7dcb76f609ce732e77486
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/50/320950/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class Environments(resource.ResourceList): def __init__(self, **kwargs): self._type = 'environments' super(Environments, self).__init__(**kwargs) @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(Environments, types.uuid, int, types.uniquelist, types.list, types.uniquelist) def get_all(self, marker=None, limit=None, sort_keys='created_at', sort_dirs='asc', fields=''): :param marker: Optional. Pagination marker for large data sets. :param limit: Optional. Maximum number of resources to return in a single result. Default value is None for backward compatibility. :param sort_keys: Optional. Columns to sort results by. Default: created_at, which is backward compatible. :param sort_dirs: Optional. Directions to sort corresponding to sort_keys, "asc" or "desc" can be chosen. Default: desc. The length of sort_dirs can be equal or less than that of sort_keys. :param fields: Optional. A specified list of fields of the resource to be returned. 'id' will be included automatically in fields if it's provided, since it will be used when constructing 'next' link. return rest_utils.get_all(Environments, Environment, db_api.get_environments, db_api.get_environment, "environments", marker=marker, limit=limit, sort_keys=sort_keys, sort_dirs=sort_dirs, fields=fields)
deleted_lines: class Environments(resource.Resource): @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(Environments) def get_all(self): LOG.info("Fetch environments.") environments = [ Environment.from_dict(db_model.to_dict()) for db_model in db_api.get_environments() ] return Environments(environments=environments)

commit_message:
FC volume driver: log the volume mappings

In some cases, the FC attached disk path cannot be retrieved.

To make debugging easier, we can log the mappings that we found for
that specific FC volume.

Change-Id: I08119a427c2f4a5ed5b782f7c90e66045cbb3fe9
(cherry picked from commit 9a403952eb1c012d3fd02cb6b8969d6c43e113bb)

commit_message:
Squash E042 and E043 bashate warnings

The bashate tool has been upgraded and now issues new warnings.

Squash these E042 and E043 warnings since our shell scripts
are doing the right thing currently and changing them to avoid
the warnings makes them less readable and more fragile.

Change-Id: I25ff337160ab176bb150a6186f6c3198cc068732

commit_message:
crypto - Add "disable_encryption" config option

On PUT and POST do not perform encryption when "disable_encryption=true"
config value is set to True or the equivalent.

Change-Id: Iac2232003249b8d8d8ce331be9210f1923f0fe1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/88/315588/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add validation of tunnel ips for gateway device

Add validation that tunnel ips are specified when creating/updating
gateway device except network_vlan type. This can avoids an error on
creating l2-gateway-connection beforehand.

Change-Id: I6284da72add0bed73482686690fd7ca6be8f801b
Closes-bug: #1574543

commit_message:
Switch to npm 3.x shrinkwrap format

npm 3.x uses deduplication by default, which allows to reduce
size of node_modules dir.

Also, this seems to be a workaround for the issue
https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/11088

Closes-Bug: #1583620

The README now mentions that we use RFEs (bugs)

commit_message:
Mention RFEs in README

The README now mentions that we use RFEs (bugs)
instead of blueprints to track features.

Change-Id: I5b717981bdb1fa514f2fbc85e80e2e23e01beba2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/47/320747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: Project status, bugs, and blueprints are tracked on Launchpad:

commit_message:
remove db2 support from tree

This removes db2 support from tree completely. This is an oddball non
open database that made doing live data migrations difficult. It is
used by 0% of users in the OpenStack User Survey.

Supporting commercial software that doesn't have users at the cost of
delivering features and fixes to our community is the wrong
tradeoff. This corrects that.

It rewrites migrations, which we typically don't ever do, but it is
better if newton fresh environments fail early in db creation instead
of very deep in the data migration process.

Change-Id: Ifeb9929e4515e3483eb65d371126afd7672b92a4

subject: Fix post jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-24 21:59:01.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/105873292bcb19834df435619e0c92fd77085ef0', 'message': 'Fix post jobs

The tox venv environment is run during post jobs and thus cannot use
constraints.

See:
http://logs.openstack.org/db/db7bdf9aa0cb0ba5fbae5ae07ecdb9f024213deb/post/keystone-docs/92d1e87/
http://logs.openstack.org/db/db7bdf9aa0cb0ba5fbae5ae07ecdb9f024213deb/post/keystone-branch-tarball/eb685ad/

We run for docs jobs:
"tox -e venv python setup.py build_sphinx"

thus, the docs environment is not used.

For branch tarball, the infra scripts use:
"tox -e venv python setup.py sdist"

And infra does not setup constraints for post jobs currently as this is
not working with current tools

Fix tox.ini for this

Change-Id: I048368981e4be739c66073fdd9bc8a9663498a80
(cherry picked from commit 2535f22e6123bd8b7ae1304b31f6748e631d8e61)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix post jobs

The tox venv environment is run during post jobs and thus cannot use
constraints.

See:
http://logs.openstack.org/db/db7bdf9aa0cb0ba5fbae5ae07ecdb9f024213deb/post/keystone-docs/92d1e87/
http://logs.openstack.org/db/db7bdf9aa0cb0ba5fbae5ae07ecdb9f024213deb/post/keystone-branch-tarball/eb685ad/

We run for docs jobs:
"tox -e venv python setup.py build_sphinx"

thus, the docs environment is not used.

For branch tarball, the infra scripts use:
"tox -e venv python setup.py sdist"

And infra does not setup constraints for post jobs currently as this is
not working with current tools

Fix tox.ini for this

Change-Id: I048368981e4be739c66073fdd9bc8a9663498a80
(cherry picked from commit 2535f22e6123bd8b7ae1304b31f6748e631d8e61)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/85/320685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-25 12:15:05.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/tests/unit/test_pathutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv/commit/5bfe8758855576a482a6395296aad161ce9f8202', 'message': "Remove unnecessary mock

In one of the unit tests, we unnecessarily mock os.path.join. This
seems to cause the test to hang on Python 3.4, as gettextutils will
hang when attempting to translate one of the messages logged by

For now, we'll just remove this mock as it's blocking the gate.

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary mock

In one of the unit tests, we unnecessarily mock os.path.join. This
seems to cause the test to hang on Python 3.4, as gettextutils will
hang when attempting to translate one of the messages logged by
the tested method.

For now, we'll just remove this mock as it's blocking the gate.
Still,We may have to understand better why we did not have this
issue before.

Change-Id: I00b0e1d2dd10a392096c35e81d402d5a4b0ef703

"""Credential object.""" from oslo_versionedobjects import base from oslo_versionedobjects import fields from senlin.db import api as db_api from senlin.objects import base as senlin_base class Credential(senlin_base.SenlinObject, base.VersionedObjectDictCompat): """Senlin credential object.""" fields = { 'user': fields.StringField(), 'project': fields.StringField(), 'cred': fields.DictOfStringField(), 'data': fields.DictOfStringField(), } @staticmethod def _from_db_object(context, credential, db_obj): for field in credential.fields: credential[field] = db_obj[field] credential._context = context credential.obj_reset_changes() return credential @classmethod def create(cls, context, values): obj = db_api.cred_create(context, values) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(context), obj) @classmethod def get(cls, context, user, project): obj = db_api.cred_get(context, user, project) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) @classmethod def update(cls, context, user, project, values): obj = db_api.cred_update(context, user, project, values) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) @classmethod def delete(cls, context, user, project): return db_api.cred_delete(context, user, project) @classmethod def update_or_create(cls, context, values): obj = db_api.cred_create_update(context, values) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj)

"""Service object.""" from oslo_versionedobjects import base from oslo_versionedobjects import fields from senlin.db import api as db_api from senlin.objects import base as senlin_base class Service(senlin_base.SenlinObject, base.VersionedObjectDictCompat): """Senlin service object.""" fields = { 'id': fields.UUIDField(), 'host': fields.StringField(), 'binary': fields.StringField(), 'topic': fields.StringField(), 'disabled': fields.BooleanField(), 'disabled_reason': fields.StringField(), } @staticmethod def _from_db_object(context, service, db_obj): for field in service.fields: service[field] = db_obj[field] service._context = context service.obj_reset_changes() return service @classmethod def create(cls, context, service_id, host=None, binary=None, topic=None): obj = db_api.service_create(context, service_id=service_id, host=host, binary=binary, topic=topic) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(context), obj) @classmethod def get(cls, context, service_id): obj = db_api.service_get(context, service_id) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) @classmethod def get_all(cls, context): objs = db_api.service_get_all(context) return [cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) for obj in objs] @classmethod def update(cls, context, obj_id, values): obj = db_api.service_update(context, obj_id, values=values) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) @classmethod def delete(cls, context, obj_id): db_api.profile_delete(context, obj_id)

fields.StringField(), 'user': fields.StringField(), 'project': fields.StringField(), 'action': fields.StringField(nullable=True), 'status': fields.StringField(), 'status_reason': fields.StringField(), 'metadata': fields.DictOfStringField(nullable=True), } @staticmethod def _from_db_object(context, event, db_obj): for field in event.fields: if field == 'metadata': event['metadata'] = db_obj['meta_data'] else: event[field] = db_obj[field] event._context = context event.obj_reset_changes() return event @classmethod def create(cls, context, values): obj = db_api.event_create(context, values) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(context), obj) @classmethod def get(cls, context, event_id, **kwargs): obj = db_api.event_get(context, event_id, **kwargs) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) @classmethod def get_by_short_id(cls, context, short_id, **kwargs): obj = db_api.event_get_by_short_id(context, short_id, **kwargs) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) @classmethod def get_all(cls, context, **kwargs): objs = db_api.event_get_all(context, **kwargs) return [cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) for obj in objs] @classmethod def count_by_cluster(cls, context, cluster_id, **kwargs): return db_api.event_count_by_cluster(context, cluster_id, **kwargs) @classmethod def get_all_by_cluster(cls, context, """Receiver object.""" from oslo_versionedobjects import base from oslo_versionedobjects import fields from senlin.db import api as db_api from senlin.objects import base as senlin_base class Receiver(senlin_base.SenlinObject, base.VersionedObjectDictCompat): """Senlin receiver object.""" fields = { 'id': fields.UUIDField(), 'name': fields.StringField(), 'type': fields.StringField(), 'cluster_id': fields.UUIDField(), 'actor': fields.DictOfStringField(nullable=True), 'action': fields.StringField(), 'params': fields.DictOfStringField(nullable=True), 'channel': fields.DictOfStringField(nullable=True), 'user': fields.StringField(), 'project': fields.StringField(), 'domain': fields.StringField(), } @staticmethod def _from_db_object(context, receiver, db_obj): for field in receiver.fields: receiver[field] = db_obj[field] receiver._context = context receiver.obj_reset_changes() return receiver @classmethod def create(cls, context, values): obj = db_api.receiver_create(context, values) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(context), obj) @classmethod def get(cls, context, receiver_id): obj = db_api.receiver_get(context, receiver_id) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) @classmethod def get_by_name(cls, context, name, **kwargs): obj = db_api.receiver_get_by_name(context, name, **kwargs) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) @classmethod def get_by_short_id(cls, context, short_id, **kwargs): obj = db_api.receiver_get_by_short_id(context, short_id, **kwargs) return cls._from_db_object(context, cls(), obj) @classmethod def get_all(cls, context, **kwargs): return db_api.receiver_get_all(context, **kwargs) @classmethod def delete(cls, context, receiver_id): db_api.receiver_delete(context, receiver_id)
